quote: Actions are judged by intentions.
reference: Narrated by Umar ibn Al-Khattab (radiyallahu anhu). Sahih Bukhari, Vol. 1, Book 1, Hadith 1

quote: The best among you are those who have the best manners and character.
reference: Narrated by Aisha (radiyallahu anha). Sahih Bukhari, Vol. 8, Book 73, Hadith 56

quote: None of you truly believes until he loves for his brother what he loves for himself.
reference: Narrated by Anas ibn Malik (radiyallahu anhu). Sahih Bukhari, Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 12

quote: Do not speak ill of the dead, for they have reached the consequences of their actions.
reference: Narrated by Abu Hurairah (radiyallahu anhu). Sunan Abu Dawood, Book 41, Hadith 4856

quote: The strong is not the one who overcomes the people by his strength, but the strong is the one who controls himself while in anger.
reference: Narrated by Sahel ibn Saad (radiyallahu anhu). Sahih Bukhari, Vol. 8, Book 73, Hadith 135

quote: A Muslim is the one from whose tongue and hands others are safe.
reference: Narrated by Sahel ibn Saad (radiyallahu anhu). Sahih Bukhari, Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 10

quote: The best of charity is that which is given by a wealthy person (from his surplus wealth) to another wealthy person.
reference: Narrated by Abu Hurairah (radiyallahu anhu). Sahih Bukhari, Vol. 2, Book 24, Hadith 507

quote: The most beloved deeds to Allah are those done consistently, even if they are small.
reference: Narrated by Aisha (radiyallahu anha). Sahih Bukhari, Vol. 8, Book 76, Hadith 472

quote: The believer does not slander, curse, or speak in an obscene or foul manner.
reference: Narrated by Abu Hurairah (radiyallahu anhu). Sunan Ibn Majah, Book 37, Hadith 3669

quote: The one who helps another in his time of need, Allah will help him in his time of need.
reference: Narrated by Abu Hurairah (radiyallahu anhu). Sunan Abu Dawood, Book 43, Hadith 4869

quote: The best of you are those who are best to their families.
reference: Sunan Ibn Majah, Vol. 1, Book 9, Hadith 1977

quote: Do not belittle any act of kindness, even the smallest, for it has great value in the sight of Allah.
reference: Sunan Ibn Majah, Vol. 1, Book 32, Hadith 4209

quote: The most beloved of people to Allah is the one who is most beneficial to people.
Avoid suspicion, for suspicion is the most deceitful of all lies.
Take advantage of five before five: your youth before old age, your health before sickness, your wealth before poverty, your free time before preoccupation, and your life before death.
Smiling in the face of your brother is an act of charity.
Verily, Allah does not look at your appearance or wealth, but He looks at your hearts and deeds.
When you see a person who has been given more than you in wealth and beauty, look to those who have been given less.
The most beloved prayer to Allah is the prayer performed on time.
The best of you are those who learn the Quran and teach it to others.
Every person makes mistakes. The most blessed of those who make errors is he who repents.
Those people who show no mercy will receive no mercy from Allah.
reference: [Muslim, Al-Fada’il (Excellent Qualities of the Prophet and His Companions); 66]

quote: Make things easier, do not make things more difficult, spread the glad tidings, do not hate.
Those who are the means for good deeds are the same as those who perform good deeds.
Who cheats us is not one of us.
Allah is pleased with the task performed by you in which both the action and duty are sound and which is performed well.
You cannot enter heaven until you believe, and you will not truly believe until you (truly) love one another.
I leave you two things. As long as you follow these, you will never go astray: Allah’s Book and the Sunnah of the Prophet.
